abstract: Shell, which beat out more than a dozen bidders, will pay $3.8 billion in cash to the Spanish energy company and assume about $1.6 billion in leases related to ship charters.
snippet: Shell, which beat out more than a dozen bidders, will pay $3.8 billion in cash to the Spanish energy company and assume about $1.6 billion in leases related to ship charters.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – The energy company Royal Dutch Shell said on Thursday that it had completed its $5.4 billion acquisition of Repsol’s liquefied natural gas business outside North America, a deal originally announced last February.

headline.main: Repsol Completes Sale of Natural Gas Assets to Shell
